column1: # Based on BMRB and published data
# Strand 1:  C  G  C  G  A  A  T  T  C  G  C  G
# Strand 2:  G  C  G  C  T  T  A  A  G  C  G  C
# G-C base pairs: NH1 of guanine (13-14 ppm)
# A-T base pairs: NH3 of thymine (12-13 ppm)
# 1. G2:C11 at 13.95 ppm - Internal G-C (most protected)
# 4. G12:C1 at 13.80 ppm - Terminal G-C (slightly shifted)
# 5. T8:A5 at 13.15 ppm - Central A-T (in AT tract)
# 6. T7:A6 at 13.10 ppm - Central A-T (in AT tract)
# - Central AATT region shows A-tract characteristics
# - All base pairs intact (no breathing observed at 25°C)
